A long time ago in a galaxy far, far away…

You

overprovisioned

nodes just in case

You forced people to open

JIRA tickets

You stared at

dashboards

to find out when to scale your nodes

You created

scaling groups

You scaled nodes when

there’s not enough

available resources

You adopted

Kubernetes

You realized that

available resources

are a silly thing to measure

You discovered

Cluster Autoscaler

kubectl apply -f scaling/go-demo-5-many.yml

kubectl -n go-demo-5 get pods,nodes

You learned that the

pending state

is not enough
